setContentIconGravity(int).Description: Set the gravity that the content icon should have within the notification display. Supported values include @B_android#view#Gravity#START_E@ and @B_android#view#Gravity#END_E@. The default value is @B_android#view#Gravity#END_E@.

getDisplayIntent().Description: Display intents are no longer supported. Get the intent to launch inside of an activity view when displaying this notification. This PendingIntent should be for an activity.
getDisplayIntent().history: Added in API level 20 Deprecated in API level 29

Parameters: String: the dismissal id of the notification.
setDismissalId(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the dismissal id for this notification. If a notification is posted with a dismissal id, then when that notification is canceled, notifications on other wearables and the paired Android phone having that same dismissal id will also be canceled. See

setCustomSizePreset(int).Description: Set the custom size preset for the display of this notification out of the available presets found in @B_android#app#Notification#WearableExtender_E@, e.g. @B_android#app#Notification#WearableExtender#SIZE_LARGE_E@. Some custom size presets are only applicable for custom display notifications created using @B_android#app#Notification#WearableExtender#setDisplayIntent_E@. Check the documentation for the preset in question. See also @B_android#app#Notification#WearableExtender#setCustomContentHeight_E@ and @B_android#app#Notification#WearableExtender#getCustomSizePreset_E@.
setCustomSizePreset(int).history: Added in API level 20 Deprecated in API level 28

Returns: true if it's ok if the background is clipped on the screen, false otherwise. The default value is false if this was never set.

Parameters: Notification.Action: the action to add to this notification
addAction(android.app.Notification.Actio.Description: Add a wearable action to this notification. When wearable actions are added using this method, the set of actions that show on a wearable device splits from devices that only show actions added using @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#addAction_E@. This allows for customization of which actions display on different devices.

Parameters: int: The index of the primary action. If wearable actions were added to the main notification, this index will apply to that list, otherwise it will apply to the regular actions list.
setContentAction(int).Description: Set an action from this notification's actions as the primary action. If the action has a @B_android#app#RemoteInput_E@ associated with it, shortcuts to the options for that input are shown directly on the notification.

clearActions().Description: Clear all wearable actions present on this builder.

getBackground().Description: Background images are no longer supported. Get a background image to be displayed behind the notification content. Contrary to the @B_android#app#Notification#BigPictureStyle_E@, this background will work with any notification style.
getBackground().history: Added in API level 20 Deprecated in API level 29

Returns: the bridge tag or null if not present.
getBridgeTag().Description: Returns the bridge tag of the notification.

Parameters: boolean: true to enable converstion and ambient.
setHintAmbientBigPicture(boolean).Description: This feature is no longer supported. Set a hint that this notification's @B_android#app#Notification#BigPictureStyle_E@ (if present) should be converted to low-bit and displayed in ambient mode, especially useful for barcodes and qr codes, as well as other simple black-and-white tickets.

getStartScrollBottom().Description: Get whether the scrolling position for the contents of this notification should start at the bottom of the contents instead of the top when the contents are too long to display within the screen. Default is false (start scroll at the top).

setGravity(int).Description: Set the gravity that this notification should have within the available viewport space. Supported values include @B_android#view#Gravity#TOP_E@, @B_android#view#Gravity#CENTER_VERTICAL_E@ and @B_android#view#Gravity#BOTTOM_E@. The default value is @B_android#view#Gravity#BOTTOM_E@.
setGravity(int).history: Added in API level 20 Deprecated in API level 28

extend(android.app.Notification.Builder).Description: Apply wearable extensions to a notification that is being built. This is typically called by the @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#extend_E@ method of @B_android#app#Notification#Builder_E@.

setContentIntentAvailableOffline(boolean.Description: Set whether the content intent is available when the wearable device is not connected to a companion device. The user can still trigger this intent when the wearable device is offline, but a visual hint will indicate that the content intent may not be available. Defaults to true.

clone().Description: Creates and returns a copy of this object. The precise meaning of "copy" may depend on the class of the object. The general intent is that, for any object x, the expression: true, but these are not absolute requirements. While it is typically the case that: true, this is not an absolute requirement. By convention, the returned object should be obtained by calling super.clone. If a class and all of its superclasses (except Object) obey this convention, it will be the case that x.clone().getClass() == x.getClass(). By convention, the object returned by this method should be independent of this object (which is being cloned). To achieve this independence, it may be necessary to modify one or more fields of the object returned by super.clone before returning it. Typically, this means copying any mutable objects that comprise the internal "deep structure" of the object being cloned and replacing the references to these objects with references to the copies. If a class contains only primitive fields or references to immutable objects, then it is usually the case that no fields in the object returned by super.clone need to be modified. The method clone for class Object performs a specific cloning operation. First, if the class of this object does not implement the interface Cloneable, then a CloneNotSupportedException is thrown. Note that all arrays are considered to implement the interface Cloneable and that the return type of the clone method of an array type T[] is T[] where T is any reference or primitive type. Otherwise, this method creates a new instance of the class of this object and initializes all its fields with exactly the contents of the corresponding fields of this object, as if by assignment; the contents of the fields are not themselves cloned. Thus, this method performs a "shallow copy" of this object, not a "deep copy" operation. The class Object does not itself implement the interface Cloneable, so calling the clone method on an object whose class is Object will result in throwing an exception at run time.

Returns: the action index or @B_android#app#Notification#WearableExtender#UNSET_ACTION_INDEX_E@ if no action was selected.
getContentAction().Description: Get the index of the notification action, if any, that was specified as the primary action. If wearable specific actions were added to the main notification, this index will apply to that list, otherwise it will apply to the regular actions list.

ClassDesc: Helper class to add wearable extensions to notifications. See To create a notification with wearable extensions: Wearable extensions can be accessed on an existing notification by using the WearableExtender(Notification) constructor, and then using the get methods to access values.
